DGACM.relevance_comment: Requests the Secretariat to continue to provide notes for the Presidents of the main organs and Chairs of their subsidiary bodies in the United Nations official language spoken by the presiding officer — a Secretariat-level instruction that maps to DGACM’s mandate to provide procedural and technical secretariat support to the General Assembly and its committees (see PPB paras 2.1(a) and Subprogramme 1 activities). DGACM would be an implementing service for this task.

Requests the Secretary‑General to complete uploading important older United Nations documents to the UN website in all six official languages — directs the Secretariat to make multilingual parliamentary/archive documents available, which DGACM implements through its documentation and publishing services (PPB paras 2.1(c), Subprogramme 3 on documentation services and Subprogramme 4 on publishing).

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to ensure, through provision of documentation services and meetings and publishing services under conference management (including high‑quality translation and interpretation), effective multilingual communication equally in all official languages — a clear directive to provide the exact services DGACM is mandated to deliver (PPB paras 2.1(a),(c),(d); Subprogrammes 3 and 4).

Encourages the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management, within existing resources and upon request, to document policy guidance regarding translation outsourcing and quality standards for use by relevant departments/offices — an explicit request directed at DGACM, matching its documentation, terminology and quality‑management responsibilities (PPB paras 2.46–2.47 on translation, quality assurance and leadership on gText/gDoc projects).

Reiterates request that the Secretary‑General ensure strict respect for rules on simultaneous distribution of documents in all six official languages (printed and online) — a Secretariat‑level obligation implemented operationally by DGACM’s documentation and publishing services responsible for simultaneous issuance (PPB Subprogramme 3 and 4, and PPB emphasis on simultaneous issuance e.g., paras 2.46–2.54).

Reiterates need to fully implement rule 55 (Journal of the United Nations shall be published in the languages of the Assembly) — directs Secretariat action to publish the Journal in all languages; DGACM operates the Journal/meeting‑information platforms in duty stations (PPB paras 2.101 on the Journal of the United Nations and Subprogramme 2/4 responsibilities for digital meeting information).

Encourages continuation of live webcasts and requests the Department of Global Communications, the Office of Information and Communications Technology and the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management to collaborate, on a cost‑neutral basis, to explore cost‑efficient technological options to ensure equal availability, searchability and user‑friendly presentation of webcast archives in all official languages — an explicit instruction naming DGACM to collaborate on a task squarely within DGACM’s remit to provide multilingual meeting/webcast and publishing services and to develop technological solutions (PPB paras 2.59, 2.67, 2.226–2.229 on digital/webcasting, eJournal, e‑services and the Global Innovation and Data Analytics Service).
